content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: The problem is easy to understand and it's easy to think of a solution quickly without requiring any expert knowledge. Just string manipulation and loops is necessary to solve it. So it's ideal for a clash.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great description

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: * le texte permet de rÃ©soudre l'Ã©nigme sans part de hasard ou de recherche
* Les cas de test sont exhaustifs
* rÃ©solu (Python) en moins de 5 minutes
Fun, explicit statement and test cases covering all situations
Fun

Title
* How many parts will there be, and how will they be different from this part?

* Since it's uncertain whether Part 1 (and potential subsequent parts) will all be approved, it would be better to rename the contribution to avoid mentioning "Part" in the title.

Input
* Please format "Line 1" and "Line 2" in <<bold>>.

* Please format "word" and "letters" as [[variables]].

Output
* Please specify that the output should contain one word per line.

* Please state that the output must be in lowercase here (not in the Constraints section).

Constraints
* Please replace "Input and output" with "[[word]] and [[letters]]".

* Please format "word" as a [[variable]] in the second and third constraints.

Cases
* Please delete the trailing newlines from the input of the cases below:
  â€¢ The alphabet (Test 2)
  â€¢ No Word and No Guesses (Test 3)

* The following cases violate the third constraint:
  â€¢ Hello! (Validator 1)
  â€¢ Random (Validator 4)

* Each test and its corresponding validator should be similar. Would you please modify any unmatched cases, e.g. by expanding a test-validator pair into two separate ones? One example that shows such an issue (though not the only one) is No Word and No Guesses (Test 3). Another example is to pair up Test 1 with a validator where the *final* letter is missing in the word.

Thanks.
I fixed everything, however, the website will not let me change the empty strings in the cases where there is no guesses. Otherwise, I changed everything else. Thank you for your feedback!

Ah, you're right. My bad.

Would you please add back this constraint (or a simplified version of it)?
* [[word]] consists of lowercase English letters and a single {{_}} only. [[letters]] can be an empty string or consist of lowercase English letters only.

Also, regarding the logic of the input, shouldn't all characters in [[word]] appear in [[letters]]? I mean only after you've guessed some letters then they appear in the word. For example, "f" isn't guessed yet it appears in the word in Test 1.

I changed what you said. Maybe instead of calling it "Hangman Combinations", I could call it "One letter missing" or something close. I'll also change the Goal to, maybe something like, "Find all combinations of a [[word]] with distinct letters, excluding the [[letters]] that have already been guessed." Thanks for your help!
Sounds good to me. I'll review the contribution again after you've made the changes ðŸ™‚

Cases
* Test 1 is the only case where [[letters]] contain duplicate letters and a letter from [[word]]. Please delete the two "i"s from [[letters]] for consistency.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer" or "write words".

Thanks.
Ok, I fixed everything. Thank you again for your help!

i got error

EOFError: EOF when reading a line

in No Word and No Guesses  case.... there is only 1 line of input case, but two lines on input in code
Which programming language did you use, and does the same issue affect both tests and validators?

i use python

i think the error is because there is no input for the Line 2

read letters:string(27) <-- this is empty

the error is also in the initial standard code
I just tested it in Python too and I got the same error. Do you have any idea to fix it? Thank you so much for finding this problem!
Try swapping the order of the input lines. If that doesnâ€™t resolve the issue, consider adding a notation (such as "0" or "-") to indicate that no guesses have been made.

Ok! I just fixed it (and I didn't need to change my solution!) I added "_" and put in the restraints that it represents no letter guessed. If any other things need to be changed, please let me know! Thank you!

looks nice.... just need to add the _ line in

No Guesses Test
More No Guesses Validator
No Guesses Test
More No Guesses Validator
Also, "(representing no letters guessed)" should be mentioned in the Input section instead of the Constraints section.
Just changed it! Thanks you so much! Is there anything else to change?

Not sure whether you've added the _ lines to the cases listed by @ManuelJ, or the CG database is still being updated and your changes haven't been shown yet?

Also, I've just noticed that the cases listed share the same names; two of them should be renamed.

Thanks.
Oh, I forgot to change the other testcases! Thank you for pointing it out. I also renamed all the testcases that were duplicates (No Guesses, Random).
All right now, thanks.
